metadata.title: CVE-2017-12448 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: The bfd_cache_close function in bfd/cache.c in the Binary File Descriptor(BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29 andearlier, allows remote attackers to cause a heap use after free andpossibly achieve code execution via a crafted nested archive file. Thisissue occurs because incorrect functions are called during an attempt torelease memory. The issue can be addressed by better input validation inthe bfd_generic_archive_p function in bfd/archive.c.

criterions.comment: binutils: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
